image.altText: Fantasia Rose Portaminni 2

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory has the highest rate of kids in care in Australia. For those leaving care at 18 years old, it can be a confusing and scary time.

title.children: Teens struggle to adjust to adult life after leaving out-of-home care

image.altText: Mid shot of a woman and a man addressing the media.

props.synopsis: In the face of a police scandal this week, the new Country Liberal Party government still managed to notch up a major win.

title.children: 'Drill, baby, drill': NT government channels Trump to overcome scandal

image.altText: Two dark-skinned hands holding some red dirt in their hands

props.synopsis: Demand for water by the resources industry and prolonged dry spells contribute to mass tree deaths in WA's mining heartland, traditional owners say.

title.children: Water extraction reduced in Pilbara after traditional owner backlash

image.altText: A yellow, orange, red sign that reads Humpty Doo Community & Child Care Centre. Animated animals pictured also

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory coroner has heard harrowing evidence about an incident at a childcare centre in Humpty Doo which led to the death of a 22-month-old girl in 2023.

title.children: Toddler likely fatally trapped by common pool fence at childcare, coroner hears

props.synopsis: Australians love an underdog and in 1983, Cliff Young transfixed the nation when he beat the world's best to shuffle to victory from Sydney to Melbourne. His legend endures.

title.children: Did Cliff Young accidentally cheat when he shuffled into Australian folklore?

image.altText: James Hardie logo on Sydney building

props.synopsis: Investors have bailed out of building products manufacturer James Hardie after it announced a $14 billion takeover in the US. Having made solid gains last week, the ASX has lost ground this morning. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: James Hardie tumbles after inking $14b deal to buy US company

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: James Hardie and Helia lead ASX lower, banks stronger
James Hardie says it is buying growth in the US

image.altText: Albanese_Cabinet_3.3.3025_ABC07694

props.synopsis: Your attention is what politicians are seeking, and they will be reaching for it everywhere they possibly can in budget week.

title.children: Government has the momentum heading into budget week

image.altText: Man on beach with four-wheel drive passing

props.synopsis: A global study finds there is "no environmentally safe level" of four-wheel drive use on beaches, prompting calls to severely limit access.

title.children: Calls for 4WD ban on the Australian beaches being 'pummelled to death'

image.altText: Papua New Guinea Prime Minister James Marape points up with his right index finger.

props.synopsis: Seventy projects outlined in a confidential PNG cabinet document include acquiring a luxury island in partnership with a Congolese rapper, exploring the potential for a world-class Formula 1 track, creating a "Silicon Valley style hub" for entrepreneurs and setting up a spy agency with training from Israel.

title.children: 'Reads more like science fiction': PNG's wish list for the future slammed

image.altText: Smoke rises after an Israeli airstrike at Nasser hospital in Gaza

props.synopsis: The Palestinian Ministry of Health in Gaza says more than 50,000 people have been killed by Israel's bombardment and invasion of the Gaza Strip.

title.children: Israel air strike hits hospital in Gaza as death toll passes 50,000

image.altText: A brown snake wraps around a bird from the gutter of a roof of a residential home.

props.synopsis: Surprised residents in WA's north-west called in the snake catcher when they found a 1.5-metre-long python devouring an unfortunate bird.

title.children: Pilbara python filmed swallowing pigeon whole

image.altText: Text message graphic.

props.synopsis: Hobart tenant Katie found out the "sublet agreement" she had signed with a company called Arx Pty Ltd could be invalid — and she had no tenancy rights in Tasmania.

title.children: A sharehouse was run by a 'sublandlord' company. It could be unlawful

image.altText: A woman with long brown hair sits on a wooden chair.

props.synopsis: The unbelievable story of adoptive parents abandoning their child — because they thought she was actually a grown woman pretending to be a child — is getting the Hollywood treatment.

title.children: Natalia Grace was nine when her parents made her become a 23-year-old

image.altText: Mark Carney standing at a lectern and speaking, holding his hand up.

props.synopsis: The contest is expected to be dominated by Canada's increasingly tense relationship with US President Donald Trump, who has labelled the country America's "51st state".

title.children: Canadian prime minister calls snap election, days after being sworn in

image.altText: Side-by-side photos of Bianca Jones and Holly Bowles, two Melbourne teens who have been hospitalised in Thailand

props.synopsis: Friends of two Melbourne teenagers who died after drinking alcohol tainted with methanol while overseas last year say a new safety campaign by the Australian government is an important step forward.

title.children: Friends of teens who died from methanol poisoning welcome safety campaign

image.altText: The causeway over Heirisson Island looking towards the city, 16 January 2015.

props.synopsis: Police are appealing for information after a woman who stepped onto the road was struck by a Transperth bus on the Causeway in East Perth, suffering fatal injuries.

title.children: Woman dies after stepping onto Perth's Causeway and being hit by bus

image.altText: Kids in hi-vis vests enjoying the sunny view from a mountain overlooking green flat land, central Victoria.

props.synopsis: Once a rite of passage, overnight excursions for students in Victoria are becoming increasingly rare.

title.children: School camp has been a rite of passage but might be a thing of the past

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Pope Francis' first public appearance in five weeks

props.synopsis: Pope Francis made his first public appearance in more than five weeks, waving from a balcony at Rome's Gemelli hospital before he was discharge from the facility on Sunday.

title.children: Pope Francis waves from balcony as he's discharged from hospital

image.altText: albanese and crisafulli shaking hands

props.synopsis: Queensland will join other states in a deal to make up the "funding shortfall" for public education, with an extra $2.8 billion from the Commonwealth over the next decade.

title.children: Queensland to get $2.8b for schools in 'biggest ever' federal funding deal

image.altText: People putting sandbags together in preparation of an incoming storm.

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology forecast potential flooding on 14 rivers in northern NSW in the wake of ex-Cyclone Alfred. While only four actually did experience a major flood, data shows that several more were close, though all river heights were eclipsed by the catastrophic floods of early 2022.

title.children: NSW towns centimetres from major flooding due to Alfred, data shows

image.altText: Steve Witkoff standing in the Oval Office speaking.

props.synopsis: European nations have rushed to boost defence spending in recent weeks, who fear the US is seeking to turn its back on them to pursue a deal with Russia.

title.children: Putin doesn't want to take 'all of Europe', US envoy says

image.altText: Mum kissing her baby's hands

props.synopsis: There are several evidence-based advantages associated with late-age births — for both mum and bub — and experts say we should be talking about them more.

title.children: The surprising health benefits linked to having a baby later in life

image.altText: A smiling boy on a rural property holds up an umbrella in heavy rain.

props.synopsis: After a hot, dry summer residents in outback Queensland are celebrating the weekend's rainfall. But on the north coast, more rain could prove to be disastrous.

title.children: Outback rain a 'cocky's dream' but a nightmare for flood-hit Queensland

image.altText: Istanbul Mayor Imamoglu speaking with a microphone wearing a suit

props.synopsis: The decision to send Mr Imamoglu to jail comes after the main opposition party, European leaders and tens of thousands of protesters criticised the actions against him as politicised and undemocratic.

title.children: Türkiye jails Istanbul mayor before corruption trial amid protests in Türkiye

image.altText: Three people on an outback track near Oodnadatta.

props.synopsis: A rescue effort will be launched in South Australia's outback to retrieve four people who, according to police, prompted a "significant search" in the state's far north, where heavy rain has closed roads.

title.children: Rescue effort for group stranded in SA outback after heavy rain closes roads

image.altText: Marlee, left, wears bright red and smiles while listening to Tamika, right, while holding mic to her.

props.synopsis: In just over an hour's run time, Skin in the Game ambitiously explores the big issues that plague rugby league and broader Australia, with Marlee Silva's own family story at its heart.

title.children: Rugby league's history of violence against women explored in new doco

image.altText: Will McLachlan of the Brisbane Lions stands on the Gabba with his hands on his hips.

props.synopsis: The decision to start the AFL clash between the Lions and Eagles at midday in late March in Brisbane is questioned by coach Chris Fagan and club legend Jason Akermanis.

title.children: Lions set for recovery week after players left 'cooked' by midday game

image.altText: A man hugs another man

props.synopsis: Ebrahim Rasool tells supporters his persona non grata status is a "badge of dignity" after his US expulsion.

title.children: Expelled South African ambassador says US sanction a 'badge of dignity'

image.altText: Lindsey Vonn cries and kisses a medal

props.synopsis: Lindsey Vonn becomes the oldest female alpine skiing medallist in a World Cup race just 11 months after having a partial knee replacement and six years after retiring.

title.children: 'Age is just a number' as Vonn creates skiing history

image.altText: Travis Head plays a pull shot

props.synopsis: Big-hitting Travis Head has launched his IPL season with a 21-ball half-century, while making life a record-breaking misery for an Ashes rival.

title.children: Travis Head hands Ashes rival Jofra Archer a record-breaking smashing in IPL

image.altText: early black and white photo of the building with horse and cart out the front

props.synopsis: From fancy balls to supporting impoverished mining families, being razed by fire to launching local film premieres, an arts venue in regional Victoria has endured for a century.

title.children: Town's beloved 100yo venue like a 'Swiss Army knife'

image.altText: Torres Strait islander woman wearing helmet with two young boys on bicycle

props.synopsis: Bicycles just weren't a thing on Thursday Island until a grassroots campaign with the backing of an enterprising mayor sparked a cultural shift.

title.children: Bicycles weren't a thing on this remote island, but that's changing
